short_summary: Tender for forklifts (rider pallet jacks) to be used at 440 Coventry.
description: 440 Coventry, a facility used by Elections Canada, is an aging facility. To ensure the longevity of the second-floor slab, a professional engineer’s report recommended a limitation in both the speed and weight of traffic. The report recommended }",“is \u00e9qupement suppl\u00e9mentaire \u00e0 ajouter \u00e0 la capacit\u00e9 op\u00e9rationnelle du premier \u00e9tage et \u00e0 affecter le deuxi\u00e8me \u00e9tage deux des chariots \\u00e9lectriques \u00e0 fourche m\u00e9caniques \u00e9quivalentes dont alors les limites de vitesse \\u00e0 observer serai-ms estab-cli au cours de l'\u00e9laboration de l'inventaire de pr\u00e9alable au d\u00e9placement des inventaires avec ces chariots, les limites sur””,
full_summary:
# Government Tender Announcement

## End-Rider Pallet Trucks

### Reference Number

* `cb-8953-24197856`

### Solicitation Number

* `ECCP-RFP-2023-2367`

### Tender Status

* Expired

### Procurement Category

* Goods and Services (GD)

### Procurement Method

* Competitive - Open Bidding

### Request for Proposal

The request for proposal (RFP) for the procurement of End-Rider Pallet Trucks is now expired. Bidders who wish to obtain the solicitation documents for this RFP must do so through the Government of Canada's procurement website, [Buy and Sell.gc.ca](https://buyandsell.gc.ca/procurement-data/tenders).

### Background

The Chief Electoral Officer of Canada (CEO), an agent of Parliament, exercises general direction and supervision over the conduct of federal elections and referendums. Two additional End-Rider Pallet Trucks are required to supplement the operating capacity at the Elections Canada Distribution Centre and to provide the flexibility to dedicate existing machines to the second floor with calibrated speed limitations.

### Requirement

Elections Canada seeks to procure two electric-powered End-Rider Pallet Trucks capable of meeting the material handling requirements at the Elections Canada Distribution Centre. The procurement goal is to secure equipment that can operate within the speed limitations required for the structural integrity of the second floor.

### Period of the Contract

The contract period is from the Effective Date of the Contract until September 30, 2024.

### Submission of Proposals

Proposals must be submitted in writing and delivered, sealed, to the Proposal Receiving Unit on or before the tender closing date and time. Communications with Elections Canada personnel must be directed only to the Contracting Authority, who will serve as the primary contact for bidders. Bidders who contact anyone other than the Contracting Authority may be disqualified. Debriefings will be provided to unsuccessful bidders upon request.

### Important Details

* The solicitation documents can be obtained through [Buy and Sell.gc.ca](https://buyandsell.gc.ca/procurement-data/tenders).
* Bidders must refer to the complete RFP document for a full description of the requirement and the full bid instructions.
* Proposals must be submitted in either official language of Canada.
* Elections Canada retains the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement.
* The Contracting Authority will be the bidder's primary contact and all communications must be directed only to them.

### Document Links

View the RFP documents online
